parameters.helpText: If checked, the banner will not be positioned absolutely, and the position parameter will be ignored.

parameters.helpText: Chevron by default

parameters.helpText: Used just to display Title Parameter

parameters.name: Title
parameters.helpText: Used just to display Title Parameter

parameters.name: Column Start
parameters.helpText: Use this to make an element start at the nth grid line

parameters.name: Column Span
parameters.helpText: Use this parameter to set number of columns item should span

parameters.name: Row Span
parameters.helpText: Use this parameter to set number of row item should span

parameters.name: Synthetic Gap
parameters.helpText: Manage spacing between components on the page

parameters.name: Full Height
parameters.helpText: If enabled, other components will appear below the fold

parameters.name: Alt Text
parameters.helpText: alt text for image

parameters.name: Width
parameters.helpText: Set this only when the 'fill' property is unchecked

parameters.name: Height
parameters.helpText: Set this only when the 'fill' property is unchecked.

parameters.name: Fill
parameters.helpText: A boolean that causes the image to fill the parent element instead of setting width and height.

parameters.name: Quality
parameters.helpText: The quality of the optimized image, where 100 is the best quality and therefore largest file size. Defaults to 75.

parameters.name: Priority
parameters.helpText: When checked, the image will be considered high priority and preload.

parameters.name: Automatic Open Timeout
parameters.helpText: In seconds. This will only be used when the trigger slot is empty.

parameters.name: Open Graph Title
parameters.helpText: page head title

parameters.name: Open Graph Description
parameters.helpText: used to set `og:description`. If not set, `Page Meta Description` will be used.

parameters.name: Open Graph Image
parameters.helpText: This will set og:image

parameters.name: Overlay Title over Open Graph Image?
parameters.helpText: if set, renders the `og:title` over the image dynamically

parameters.name: Open Graph Type
parameters.helpText: sets the value of `og:type` (defalts to "website" if not specified)

parameters.name: Twitter Title
parameters.helpText: Sets `twitter:title`. Fallback to Page Title if not set.

parameters.name: Twitter Description
parameters.helpText: Sets `twitter:description`. Falls back to `Page Meta Description` if not set

parameters.name: Twitter Image
parameters.helpText: Sets `twitter:image`. Fallsback to `og:image` if not set.

parameters.name: Overlay Title to Twitter Image?
parameters.helpText: if set, overlays content of `twitter:title` over the image dynamically

parameters.name: Twitter Card
parameters.helpText: Sets the value of `twitter:card`. If not set, defaults to `summary`.

parameters.name: Placeholder Image
parameters.helpText: You can replace video preview image by using this parameter. Work only when light is checked

parameters.name: Lazy Load
parameters.helpText: Check to show just the video thumbnail, which loads the full player on click

parameters.name: Loop
parameters.helpText: Check or unchek to loop the media

parameters.name: Controls
parameters.helpText: Check or uncheck to display native player controls.  For Vimeo videos, hiding controls must be enabled by the video owner.

parameters.name: Muted
parameters.helpText: Mutes the player

description.value: A Carousel component is versatile sinceit can render any child component, allowing for interactive content display in a confined space.

text.value: Each slide in this carousel contains a Hero as a child component

description.value: A Carousel component allows you to showcase a larger number of content items within a limited space, ensuring that your audience can easily view and engage with a variety of content without overwhelming the user interface.

With navigation controls, such as arrow buttons or indicators, users can actively navigate through the Carousel, giving them control over the displayed content and creating an engaging and interactive experience.

Carousels are ideal for situations where space is limited. By presenting multiple components within a single container, a Carousel maximizes the use of available screen real estate, allowing you to display a diverse range of content without cluttering the interface.

text.value: Each slide in this carousel contains an Image as a child component
Each slide in this carousel contains 3 Call to Actions as a child components

some compelling content for the second call to action.
some compelling content for the third call to action.

text.value: Each slide in this carousel contains an Image as a child component

description.value: Enhance your content with the versatile Rich Text component, allowing you to create visually appealing and formatted text with ease.

title.value: Rich Text on a light background

children.text: Exploring the Power of Rich Text: Unlocking Creative Content Creation
Rich Text
components are
powerful tools

that enable users to enhance their content with a wide range of formatting options, transforming ordinary text into visually appealing and dynamic representations. With their versatile capabilities, Rich Text components offer numerous benefits to users, making them a valuable asset in various
contexts
Benefits

Enhanced Visual Appeal: Rich Text components allow users to apply formatting options such as bold, italics, underlining, font styles, sizes, and colors, resulting in visually appealing and attractive content.

Improved Readability: By utilizing headings, subheadings, bullet points, and numbered lists, Rich Text components help users organize and structure their content, making it easier to read and comprehend.

Emphasizing Key Points: With features like bold and italics, Rich Text components enable users to highlight important information and emphasize key points, ensuring that crucial details stand out to the reader.

Flexibility in Content Organization: Rich Text components offer the flexibility to align text, adjust margins, create indents, and format paragraphs, allowing users to optimize the layout and presentation of their content.
Why we should use it?

Multimedia Integration: Users can seamlessly incorporate multimedia elements such as images, videos, audio files, hyperlinks, and interactive elements into their text, enriching the content and enhancing the user experience.

Collaboration and Version Control: Rich Text components facilitate collaborative work by allowing multiple users to make real-time edits, track changes, add comments, and revert to previous versions, promoting efficient teamwork and effective communication.
Accessibility: Rich Text components often support accessibility features such as screen readers, making the content accessible to individuals with disabilities and ensuring inclusivity.

Cross-Platform Compatibility: Rich Text components are compatible with various platforms and devices, allowing users to access and edit their content seamlessly across desktop computers, laptops, tablets, and mobile phones.

Time Efficiency: With intuitive interfaces and user-friendly controls, Rich Text components simplify the content creation process, saving users time and effort in formatting and structuring their text.
Rich Text
components are also
user-friendly

and accessible. Users with limited technical knowledge can easily navigate the intuitive interface, and the formatting options are often presented in a familiar and straightforward manner. Additionally,
Rich Text components usually support screen readers and other assistive technologies, enabling individuals with disabilities to access and interact with the content effectively.

title.value: Rich Text on a dark background

pageMetaDescription.value: Essential set of components you need to start building personalizable web experiences with Uniform.

description.value: An essential set of components you need to start building personalized web experiences with Uniform.

title.value: How will Component Starter Kit help you?

description.value: The Component Starter kit gives you the key building blocks to create dynamic and compelling web experiences and demonstrate the power of digital experience composition in Uniform. Just install, customize and start creating.
We designed the starter kit for you to take it home and customize it according to your needs. Go nuts!
Lightweight React components help keep your Core Web Vitals green.
The whole library is open source and based on TailwindCSS and DaisyUI, making it easy for you to adapt to your brand style.
Our Component Starter Kit is built on a TNT stack - Typescript, Next.js, and TailwindCSS. That means its completely customizable and adaptable for what you need to build.

title.value: Bring your CMS and commerce content

description.value: Leverage our latest integrations to bring content from your own Headless CMS and/or Commerce systems without any glue code.

title.value: No integration? No problem. No code required.

description.value: Bring content from any REST API without a single developer ticket.

title.value: Build web experiences visually with real-time preview

description.value: Create new pages from existing components, try different variants and customize the theme.

title.value: Unleash your content. Unchain from the backlog.

description.value: Our Component Starter Kit is built on a TNT stack - Typescript, Next.js, and TailwindCSS. That means its completely customizable and adaptable for what you need to build.
Not just for one day
Pick a card, any card
The call of the wild
There are lots of components to choose from, but these are our favorites. There are more coming, so it's always worth checking again.

title.value: How much does the Component Starter Kit cost?

description.value: Exactly $0. These components are totally open source and available for anyone to use.

title.value: Can I use these components for commercial projects?

description.value: Yes you can! Wed be very happy if you do.
There will be, and we have some big ideas. Get in touch if theres anything you want to see here.

title.value: Can I connect my own content and data to these components?

description.value: Of course! You can use a pre-built Uniform integration or connect to any REST-based API source using Uniform. You can learn more in our documentation.

The Divider component allows adding hairline dividers between components using desired thickness and color from the currently selected theme. Thickness options are configurable by the developer on the parameter settings.

description.value: The Spacer component allows adding spacing between components using transparent space. Spacing is configurable by the developer on parameter settings. With vertical and horizontal variants, it gives you complete control over content arrangement and layout. Whether you want to create a breathing room or organize elements with precision, this feature lets you fine-tune the spacing to suit your needs.
